titleStmt.title: Edwin Clark Punchard and Company an Alfred Escher, Mailand, Samstag, August 26, 1871

publicationStmt.p: Digitale Briefedition Alfred Escher, Zürich: Alfred Escher-Stiftung.

seg.note: Nachträgliche Notiz oben in der Mitte auf Seite 1 von dritter Hand mit roter Farbe: 940 (sammt Beilage).

div.p:
Mr Monsieur (Herr) Alfred Escher Member of the
St. Gothard Committee
Zürich

We are anxious in the first instance to
thank you for your kindness in forwarding us
the plans and other information on the subject
of the proposed St. Gothard line.

We have now had an opportunity in com
pany with a staff of experienced Engineers
of inspecting the line throughout. This inspection
has confirmed the opinion we expressed to you
on first seeing the plans, that as regards its
practical details the line may be modified
to a considerable extent with very great ad
vantage and without affecting the data given;
and by these alterations a great economy both
in time and money may be effected.

We have received letters from our financial
correspondents in London, and although
we are of course unable to make at once a
definitive proposition, We are anxious to assure
you of our serious desire to take a large share
in this important work, if it is possible for us
to do so. And we are anxious that this should
not be confined to the technical portion only;
and we shall therefore esteem it a great favour
if you can assist us in any suggestion as to
to the best manner for proceeding farther.

We feel naturally much difficulty in this
respect, more especially as you informed us
that the financial portion of the business
might in all probability be definitely settled
in the course of a few days. We are therefore
in ignorance as to the whether any financial
proposition would still be acceptable.

We feel bound to express our firm belief
that in the execution of the work we shall
be able to introduce modifications of the
very highest importance, which could not
fail to meet with your approbation, and
which would place the estimate on an enti
rely new basis, and effect a most important
saving in the cost and time of execution.
But on the other hand we shall be quite
prepared to enter into a firm Contract for the
whole or any large portion of the work pre
cisely as it is laid out, leaving the modi
fications which we shall suggest for your
future consideration.

In conclusion, we shall esteem it a great
favour if you will inform us:

1. Whether our proposition shall be both
financial and technical.

2. In case the financial question is settled
whether it is possible for us to unite ourselves
with any combination that may have been
formed

3. Whether our proposition should extend
to the whole work, or only a portion of it
in which latter case we should prefer the
more difficult portion.

We return immediately to London in
order to discuss the matter more fully with
our friends, and shall be prepared on receipt
of your reply to take every step that may be
necessary for the immediate prosecution of
the business.

in Florence:
Chez Monsr Monsieur (Herr) Edouard Gioja Ingénieur, 3. Via
della Fogna.
Edwin Clark Punchard & Co Compagnia / Compagnie / Company (Gesellschaft)
